snippet: While Beijing’s air quality has generated more headlines worldwide, scientists say New Delhi’s air is often significantly worse, but only now are residents turning to surgical masks and air purifiers.
abstract: New Delhi residents, in major attitude shift, are beginning to react to city's air pollution, which is considered most toxic in the world; many say that while major policy change by India's government is unlikely, growing recognition is first step to addressing problem.
lead_paragraph: While Beijing’s air quality has generated more headlines worldwide, scientists say New Delhi’s air is often significantly worse, but only now are residents turning to surgical masks and air purifiers.

headline.main: Delhi Wakes Up to an Air Pollution Problem It Cannot Ignore
headline.print_headline: Delhi Wakes Up to Problem It Cannot Ignore
